definition: to hit back/to retaliate
surname Huan
to pay back/to return
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Goofy feel doubt, Huang Cheng call her when she strike back?
sentences.chinese: 高飞觉得疑惑，黄成打她的时候她还手了吗？

sentences.english: I got to my feet and tried to fight back but another blow sent me flying.
sentences.chinese: 我挣扎着站起来并且打算还手，但又是一拳将我打倒。

sentences.english: Teacher hit me. I hit back, and got kicked out of school,and created a riot and so forth.
sentences.chinese: 老师打我，我还手了，因此我被赶出了学校。

sentences.english: I think it was one of those hippie fucks who first said he wouldn't fight.
sentences.chinese: 我想嬉皮士们是他妈的第一个说，我不会还手的。

sentences.english: So I'd visit a mill and send them photos of myself in a baker's hat and jacket, holding a sign that said 'I want to be your baker.'
sentences.chinese: 相片上我还手拿一个标语‘我要做你的面包师。’

sentences.english: One day I dreamt that Geeta slapped me back.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我梦见吉塔还手扇了我耳光。

sentences.english: Geeta is the only living creature I have been able to slap without retaliation.
sentences.chinese: 吉塔是惟一一个我打了不还手的大活人。

sentences.english: If you beat me again, I will fight back.
sentences.chinese: 要是你再打我，我就还手了。

definition: to resist/to ward off/to hold one's own/to receive guests
to hit back/to return fire
to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
to resist/to rebel
to be looking for one's teeth all over the floor/(fig.) to get beaten up badly/to beat the crap out of (sb)
to kneel and beg forgiveness
utterly defeated
(coll.) to take a taxi/to go by taxi
leeward/downwind/disadvantageous position/to concede or give way in an argument
to flee in defeat/to bolt
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
to overthrow/to knock down/Down with ... !
unable to defeat/to be no match for sb
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to relent (to spare sb's feelings)/to show mercy or forgiveness/to forbear/lenient
to beat up/to break to pieces
